newsitem.title: NORWAY: Hijacker of Bulgarian plane arrested in Oslo.
newsitem.headline: Hijacker of Bulgarian plane arrested in Oslo.

text.p: A Palestinian who hijacked a Bulgarian charter plane to Norway on Tuesday was arrested at Oslo airport less than an hour after landing, police said.
"The man surrendered at 8.47 p.m. (1847 GMT)," a police spokesman said. "He asked for a lawyer. He asked for political asylum. He said there is no weapon on board but we will check for ourselves."

"He has not given any political motive," police superintendent Asbjoern Gran told reporters. "The only demands he put forth were to obtain a lawyer, which is easy to fulfil, and to gain political asylum. Maybe all he wanted was to get here. He is between 20 and 30 years old."

The plane was commandeered on a flight from Beirut to Varna airport near Bulgaria's Black Sea coast earlier on Tuesday. The hijacker released all 150 passengers at Varna before ordering the crew of eight to take off on the three-hour flight to Oslo.
Bulgarian officials said the man was a Palestinian who used a bomb to hijack the plane on a flight from Beirut to Bulgaria.
